meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be divided into parts.
meanings.sent1: The partibility of the cake allowed everyone to have a slice.
meanings.sent2: The partibility of the puzzle made it easy to share among friends.
meanings.sent3: The partibility of the sandwich made it perfect for our picnic.
meanings.sent4: The partibility of the city into neighborhoods created a sense of community.
meanings.sent5: The partibility of the book into chapters made it easier to read.

meanings.definition: The ability to be separated or divided.
meanings.sent1: The partibility of the fabric made it simple to cut for sewing.
meanings.sent2: The partibility of the cells allowed for easy analysis under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The partibility of the team into smaller groups made the game more interesting.
meanings.sent4: The partibility of the music into different instruments added depth to the composition.
meanings.sent5: The partibility of the land into plots made it easier for farming.
